# resume(id:)

**Instance Method**

Resumes the alarm with the specified ID if it’s in the paused state.

## Declaration

```swift
func resume(id: Alarm.ID) throws
```

## Parameters

- **id**: The identifier of the alarm to resume.

## Discussion

The function throws otherwise. Sets the alarm to the [doc://com.apple.alarmkit/documentation/AlarmKit/AlarmPresentationState/Mode-swift.enum/Countdown] state

## Changing an alarm state

- **cancel(id:)**: Cancels the alarm with the specified ID.
- **countdown(id:)**: Performs a countdown for the alarm with the specified ID if it’s currently alerting.
- **pause(id:)**: Pauses the alarm with the specified ID if it’s in the countdown state.
- **stop(id:)**: Stops the alarm with the specified ID.
